result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter S. Volk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: conditions of probation 9 months county jail with huber report 2-9-16 credit for  134 days; fine/costs $979.00, restitution of 138.50 to Pawn America and $243.53 plus $500.00 per year security fee while on probation, and $1500.00 for gate and 250.00 for window grills to Wayne Halberg plus surcharges;   Absolute Sobriety,    No drug use without a valid prescription.  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations, no contact with the Walbergs or co defendant Zach Batley,   Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.

Warrant authorized previously is quashed.  DE states he was incarcerated for forgetting to pay a speeding ticket at time of July hearing and was unable to call the court to advise.  DE recently lost his job and contacted the Public Defender's Office today for counsel.  Court does NOT order any bail forfeiture at this time, but advises DE of consequences for his actions.
